image.altText: smelter factory external shots

props.synopsis: Australia's only manganese smelter is at the centre of a dispute, after failing to restart a troubled smelter in Tasmania's north despite being given a $20 million loan from the Tasmanian government.

title.children: Tasmania gave GFG Alliance a loan for ore supply. But now the ore isn’t being used

image.altText: A man in a truckers cap sits behind the wheel of a white van, smiling as the sun shines through the windscreen.

props.synopsis: Laurie Burgess has dedicated two decades to transporting artwork across the country, and has developed an appreciation and knowledge of the Australian art world few could rival.

title.children: Laurie works 16-hour days delivering artworks around Australia

image.altText: A collapsed power pole lying across a fence and the grass.

props.synopsis: Two people have died after a tree fell on them on a rural property in Tasmania's north-west, during Friday's severe winds and wet weather, police say.

title.children: Two dead after tree falls in Tasmanian wild weather, outages continue

image.altText: Nevada regulators grill Ainsworth boss

props.synopsis: Regulators in the world's most influential gaming jurisdiction have dismissed a licence bid by the boss of Australia's Ainsworth Game Technology, branding him "arrogant", "misleading" and lacking in "emotional intelligence".

title.children: Las Vegas hearing turns nightmare for boss of Australian pokies giant

image.altText: Sebastien Lecornu whispers to France's President Emmanuel Macron.

props.synopsis: 39-year-old Sebastian Lecornu, who was first elected prime minister on September 9 but resigned on Monday after 26 days in office, says he changed his mind "out of duty", with France

title.children: Macron reappoints Lecornu as France's PM four days after his resignation

image.altText: A purple NDIS sign on the side of an office building.

props.synopsis: Proceedings began against the now-defunct provider following the death of a Queensland participant in 2023. The penalty is the highest civil sanction imposed on an NDIS provider to date.

title.children: NDIS provider fined $2.2m after man killed walking into highway traffic

image.altText: A person in dark clothing holding a long edged weapon.

props.synopsis: Investigators say a brawl between two groups armed with machetes spilled into a shopping centre in Broadmeadows on Friday night.

title.children: Police investigate 'terrifying' machete brawl at Melbourne shopping centre

image.altText: Nestory Irankunda slides on his knees

props.synopsis: Nestory Irankunda's late strike has given the Socceroos a 1-0 victory over FIFA 2026 World Cup co-hosts Canada in in Montreal.

title.children: Late Irankunda goal seals Socceroos win over Canada in Montreal

image.altText: People walking along Pall Mall in Bendigo.

props.synopsis: A collection of photographs taken by an amateur photographer in a regional Victorian city in the 1950s, 60s and 70s has been returned.

title.children: Trove of historical photos taken by a tailor a 'brilliant time capsule'

image.altText: Maria Grazia Chiuri (1)

props.synopsis: Men sit at the top of the world's fashion houses while women designers get torn apart online.

title.children: You might end up wearing fashion's misogyny problem

image.altText: A small black dog with its tongue sticking out and looking at camera

props.synopsis: The Bunbury Magistrates Court hears how Stanley J Clemons shot his neighbour's dog and discarded its body, which still has not been found.

title.children: Neighbour shot and killed barking chihuahua and hid it, court told

image.altText: Fire on the ground following an explosion.

props.synopsis: The explosion at Accurate Energetic Systems in rural Tennessee on Friday morning is heard from miles away and is described by local law enforcement as "one of the worst" tragedies the area has seen.

title.children: Blast at US munitions plant leaves 19 people feared dead

image.altText: a female Aboriginal elder with short white hair and blue eyes

props.synopsis: It has been close to three decades since Irene Davey's daughter disappeared, now she is taking her case to the United Nations in an attempt to finally get justice.

title.children: Mum calls for apology over 'mishandling' of her daughter's disappearance

image.altText: Derek Gee rides his bike

props.synopsis: Canadian cyclist Derek Gee terminates his contract with Israel-Premier Tech due to a "safety and personal-belief" standpoint, but says the team is seeking damages worth 30 million Euros ($54 million) as a result.

title.children: 'Weighed heavily on my conscience': Cyclist faces $54m 'damages' bill

image.altText: Three chrome-clad trucks full of colours and bright lights sit on a road.

props.synopsis: The dekotora, large decorated trucks covered in colour and bright lights, were once a common sight across Japan. Now they are fighting for survival.

title.children: Why these famous Japanese trucks are at risk of 'extinction'

image.altText: Shirtless man in sporting ring with hands out

props.synopsis: Police had intelligence that Sydney's Alameddine organised crime network wanted a former UFC fighter dead more than 18 months before his shooting murder this week.

title.children: Police believe crime network targeted UFC fighter in retaliation for 'drug rip'

image.altText: A man in a suit and tie sits in a darkened room clutching a piece of paper.

props.synopsis: A $40 million overcharging bungle by WA's largest energy retailer was a result of serious governance failures and other businesses may have also fallen foul according to the state's economic watchdog.

title.children: Synergy overcharged for 15 years, other companies have done similar

image.altText: Two men embrace while sitting in parliament

props.synopsis: If there was some internal call within the Liberals to show some discipline after the last few weeks, it worked at a basic level.

title.children: Question Time shenanigans show Liberals can score

image.altText: Dave Casey rolls his SuperUte

props.synopsis: Dave Casey rolls his Mitsubishi Triton twice on race two of the V8 SuperUte Series at the Bathurst 1000, but walks away from the incident.

title.children: Barrel rolling ute causes safety car at Bathurst

image.altText: A middle-aged blonde woman in glasses looks pensive as she sits at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Property analysts, brokers and banks report more borrowers are taking on big housing debts in their late 40s and 50s and, potentially, a retirement still saddled with mortgage repayments.

title.children: Mortgage holders may soon face similar dilemma to renters in retirement

image.altText: Maria Corina Machado speaking, clutching flowers and clenching her fist.

props.synopsis: The Venezuelan opposition leader is awarded the prize for "her tireless work promoting democratic rights" in the country.

title.children: Venezuelan politician María Corina Machado receives Nobel Peace Prize

image.altText: Small palm tree up pole, Illawarra Hotel exterior sign.

props.synopsis: A Wollongong hotel owner goes to unusual heights to mock a controversial piece of public art and protest against a council decision to knock back a development application.

title.children: Hotel owner mocks council's palm tree art after renovation refusal

image.altText: A mbald man sitting a computer witha colourful display of data on the screen.

props.synopsis: University of Queensland researcher Arutha Kulasinghe studied lung biopsies from the tumours of almost 250 patients with non-small cell lung cancer across Australia, the United States and Europe.

title.children: 'Revolutionary' research predicts success of lung cancer treatment

image.altText: Sunrise over a pier at lake macquarie in toronto new south wales

props.synopsis: An atmospheric "tug of war" for control of Australia's weather is taking place this spring, and it is a forecasting nightmare.

title.children: Promised rain overwhelmed by dry westerlies, chaotic weather forecast

image.altText: A black and white photo of two men in slouched hats

props.synopsis: It started a researcher down a rabbit hole "beyond anything anyone could ever dream up", involving deception, double agents, secret names and plans for a genocide.

title.children: The Australian POWs who became double agents and uncovered genocidal plans

image.altText: A woman with long blonde hair speaks at a blue lectern

props.synopsis: The US first lady tells reporters at the White House that eight children have been reunited with their families in the last 24 hours.

title.children: Melania Trump reveals ongoing talks with Putin on returning Ukrainian children

image.altText: Two people with full face helmets sit in a jet boat as it races fast on water

props.synopsis: From tractors to jet boats at Elmore, as Victoria prepares to host Australian series jet boat event in 2026.

title.children: V8 jet boats set to roar in Victoria at new custom built track

image.altText: A ceramic cross and dog statue

props.synopsis: Northern Territory police have defended taking five days to appeal for information about a woman’s death in Darwin’s northern suburbs last month, since alleged to be a domestic violence-related murder.

title.children: Police defend taking five days to declare alleged NT DV death 'suspicious'

image.altText: Donald Trump gestures as he holds a press conference in alaska

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has not been awarded the Nobel Peace Prize. Despite his persistent claim that he "deserves" it, experts are not at all surprised he is not the recipient.

title.children: Donald Trump had 'no chance' of receiving Nobel Peace Prize

image.altText: Mounted police during a search for a missing boy.

props.synopsis: The thought of a missing boy lost in the outback is indescribably harrowing — but what's almost as disturbing is the realisation that some on social media have seized on the disappearance of four-year-old Gus as an opportunity to spread misinformation.

title.children: AI-generated misinformation about 4yo Gus prompts tech and legal concerns

image.altText: A man wearing a beanie and scarf sitting in the stands of a stadium.

props.synopsis: The new second division for Australian football has been dubbed a second chance for some of the country's oldest clubs, which hope it will usher in a new era for the game.

title.children: The Australian Championship a second chance for 'heartbeat' of football

image.altText: A WWE replica belt hangs around a man's neck. He stands in the middle of a large crowd.

props.synopsis: Wrestling mania hits Perth, with a three-day World Wrestling Entertainment blockbuster featuring stars like John Cena expected to draw tens of thousands of people.

title.children: Huge crowds flood Perth for WWE blockbuster featuring John Cena

image.altText: A serving of fattet hummus with torn pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky yoghurt sauce, with ingredients alongside.

props.synopsis: This popular vegetarian Lebanese dish with crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and a garlicky tahini yoghurt sauce is ready in 30 minutes.

title.children: Crispy pita bread, warm chickpeas and garlic yoghurt is an easy dinner
